metadata.title: CVE-2015-4512 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
gfx/2d/DataSurfaceHelpers.cpp in Mozilla Firefox before 41.0 on Linuximproperly attempts to use the Cairo library with 32-bit color-depthsurface creation followed by 16-bit color-depth surface display, whichallows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memoryor cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) by using a CANVAS elementto trigger 2D rendering.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4512` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
